svcproc.title: JACKET TUBE BEARING REPLACEMENT
svcproc.para: The steering tube bearings are ball bearings. The outer race of the bearing is long with a lip to properly locate it in the steering jacket tube.

The replacement operation will require removal of the steering wheel, turn signal control, and trailer hand brake mounted on the steering column. It will not be necessary to remove the entire steering column assembly.

step1.para:
Remove the steering wheel. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, STEERING WHEEL
.
Remove the steering column bracket caps and slide the steering jacket tube from the steering drive shaft.

caution.para: Be careful when removing the steering jacket tube so as not to break off the steering jacket tube location pin on the steering column mounting bracket.

step1.para: Place the steering jacket tube in a vise.

caution.para: Use copper vise jaw covers or cushion the jaws with a rag. Take special care not to deform the tube by overtightening the vise.

step1.para: Remove the bearing using an inside puller, OEM-4254 or equivalent ( Figure 5).
Pack the new bearing with Fleetrite EP2 moly grease or equivalent NLGI #2 lithium grease.
Install the bearings in the jacket tube. Be careful to start the bearings straight and tap gently to avoid damage to the bearing or steering tube.

Slide the steering tube over the steering drive shaft and align with the locating pin in the steering column mounting bracket. Replace the bracket caps and universal joint cover and tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART
.
Re-install the turn signal control, trailer hand brake control and steering wheel, and connect the horn wiring.
